Conf.Index_10: Apply protection to local and remote addresses
Conf.Index_11: Allow username protection to lock the 'root' user

WhiteList.Index_1: IP addresses on the whitelist can always log in to your server
WhiteList.Index_2: You may include an optional comment with each IP address
WhiteList.Index_3: Example: 169.254.1.1 # Comment for this IP address
WhiteList.Index_4: You can also paste in the contents of a previously downloaded whitelist

BlackList.Index_1: IP addresses on the blacklist can never log in to your server

Anti.Index_4: After turn on, the system will restrict user operation commands and record tracking
Anti.Index_5: When turn off the system, only record and track the commands that the user has operated
Anti.Index_6: At present, the default is only for intrusion problems caused by user www, redis, mysql operations

Anti.Index_26: The full path of the protected file or dir

Anti.Index_32: [Append] You can only add content, not delete or modify the original content
Anti.Index_33: [Permissions] Set the permissions of a file or directory in a protected state, and auto restore it after turn off
Anti.Index_34: [How to set] Please fill in the Linux Permissions code, such as: 644, 755, etc
